content: This might be of interest to our members: https://cdt.org/press/cdt-and-ehi-release-draft-consumer-privacy-framework-for-health-data/#:~:text=Today%20the%20eHealth%20Initiative%20%26%20Foundation,rules%20that%20should%20govern%20them.

quick diagonal reading, says "A participating entity collecting, disclosing, or using consumer health information must limit the collection, disclosure, or use of consumer health information to only what the consumer has expressly consented to."
How is this applied to care provision?

No penalties or incentives, but significant self-voluntary cost to implement (and disadvantage relative to competition). It's also extremely broad in the companies it might cover. Seems like it will take regulation to be used/relevant?
